items.title: The iPhone 17 comes with Apple’s new in-house networking chip
items.summary: Inside Apple’s splashy iPhone 17 lineup is a new chip: the N1. It’s a wireless networking chip made in-house by Apple, allowing its devices to support the latest networking technologies, including Wi-Fi 7, Bluetooth 6, and the smart home protocol Thread. Apple previously used chips made by Broadcom to power Bluetooth and Wi-Fi within its […]

items.title: This tiny 46-in-1 precision screwdriver set is yours for $14.50 Prime shipped (24% off)
items.summary:
ORIA 46-in-1 Precision Screwdriver Set

Buy for $14.50 (Reg. $19)

Clip the on-page 20% off coupon.

What we love

This affordable tool kit from ORIA wields more than 40 magnetic bits, all of which fit inside of the included storage case. The entire kit is designed to be incredibly compact, measuring just 5.8 by 1.5 by 1.5 inches in size. I bought an iFixit kit a while back and despite having roughly the same amount of bits, it’s a whole lot larger than this one.

These offerings also join its more sporty cases and the magnetic back case we featured last year. Proper camera buttons are at the ready on everything. Details below.

items.title: JBL’s Flip 7 waterproof Bluetooth speaker with interchangeable accessories is back to $100 low
items.summary:
As part of its wider sale on audio gear, Woot is now offering JBL’s Flip 7 portable Bluetooth speaker in blue for $99.95 Prime shipped (a $6 delivery fee will apply otherwise). This model debuted back in April with a $150 price tag, and today’s deal knocks $50 off, bringing it back down to the lowest price we tracked before the recent Prime Day sale. Unlike last time, though, even the black and red variants are down to $100 low today, making this a great time to cash in and pick between a few color options. For comparison, Amazon still has it listed at the full $150, so be sure to jump in and lock in the discounted prices at Woot.

items.title: Save up to $770 on Anker’s three SOLIX EverFrost 2 electric coolers/bundles starting from a new $599 low
items.summary:
As part of its Fan Fest Sale that will be running through September 21, Anker is offering some of the best prices yet on its SOLIX EverFrost 2 Portable Electric Coolers, with the newest 23L model dropping down to $599 shipped, which beats out Amazon’s pricing by $1. While the 40L and 58L models hit the market back in March, this smaller model was just recently released at the top of June and normally fetches $799 at full price. Discounts in the time since have mostly seen slight $50 cuts from the tag, though it did drop down to $600 twice in August with Prime-exclusive savings. The deal we’re seeing during this sale comes lower than ever as $200 is cut from the going rate, giving you the lowest price we have tracked. Head below for more on this series of coolers and to check out the full lineup of deals for them.

items.title: All of the must-see 25W Qi2.2 MagSafe charging gear debuting ahead of iPhone 17
items.summary:
Apple is revealing all of its “Awe dropping” new gear today and we are at Steve’s Jobs Theater to catch it all in person. The new slate of third-party accessories are bursting at the seams today and Apple have a new lineup of accessories of its own on display today, but the biggest thing in iPhone add-ons is perhaps all of the new 25W Qi2.2 gear. We will be charging our next-gen (or iPhone 16) Apple handsets faster than ever this year and there is already some intriguing new 25W gear surfacing ahead of iPhone 17 reveal day.

When it is at full price, you’ll often find it ranging between $200 and $230, with the discounts we’ve spotted this year mostly keeping things around $173, though we’ve been seeing more recent returns to $170 and the $169 low. While it may have gone lower in past years, today’s deal gives you a $60 price cut to the third-lowest price we have tracked in 2025 – just $1 above the annual low.

items.summary:
While its Labor Day event has ended, EcoFlow is still far from done offering discounts with its current Home Backup/Hurricane Preparedness Sale running through September 14. Among the lineup, we’ve spotted returning deals (and officially new lows) on the new TRAIL series of power stations, with the TRAIL 200 DC 60,000mAh Portable Power Station back at $113.05 shipped, after using the sitewide code 25EFDCAFF at checkout for an additional 5% taken off your order, while the TRAIL 300 DC 90,000mAh Portable Power Station is at $151.05 shipped, after using the same promo code. They’d normally fetch $200 and $250 at full price, which we saw brought down to these same rates during last month’s launch. This sale gives you another shot at the best prices we have tracked, saving you $87 and/or $99 off the respective models. Head below for more on these and the other offers we’re seeing during this sale.

more…
